front.question: Is HTML5 backward compatible with old browsers?
front.answerDetails: Yes! HTML5 is designed, as much as possible, to be backward compatible with existing web browsers.

back.question: Is HTML5 backward compatible with old browsers?
back.answerDetails: Yes! HTML5 is designed, as much as possible, to be backward compatible with existing web browsers.

questionList.question: Is HTML5 backward compatible with old browsers?
questionList.answerDetails: Yes! HTML5 is designed, as much as possible, to be backward compatible with existing web browsers.

questionList.question: Which of the following tag represents the footer of a section in HTML5?
questionList.answerDetails: 'footer' tag represents the footer of a section.

questionList.question: Which of the following input control accepts only numerical value in Web Form 2.0?
questionList.answerDetails: 'number' input control accepts only numerical value. The step attribute specifies the precision, defaulting to 1.

questionList.question: Which of the following tag insists to have a value in an input control in HTML5?
questionList.answerDetails: HTML5 introduced a new attribute called required which would insist to have a value in an input control.

questionList.question: When a session storage data gets deleted in HTML5?
options: The Session Storage Data would be deleted by the browsers immediately after the session gets terminated.
If you want to clear all settings, you need to call localStorage.clear() method.
answers: The Session Storage Data would be deleted by the browsers immediately after the session gets terminated.
questionList.answerDetails: The Session Storage Data would be deleted by the browsers immediately after the session gets terminated.

questionList.question: Which of the following is true about 'canvas' tag in HTML5?
options: HTML5 element <canvas> gives you an easy and powerful way to draw graphics using JavaScript.
It can be used to draw graphs, make photo compositions or do simple (and not so simple) animations.
questionList.answerDetails: Both of the above options are correct.

questionList.question: Which of the following attribute specifies if the element must have it's spelling or grammar checked?
questionList.answerDetails: spellcheck − Specifies if the element must have it's spelling or grammar checked.

questionList.question: Which of the following attribute triggers event when a context menu is triggered?
questionList.answerDetails: oncontextmenu − Triggers event when a context menu is triggered.

questionList.question: Which of the following attribute triggers event when dragged element is being dropped?
questionList.answerDetails: ondrop − Triggers event when dragged element is being dropped.

questionList.question: Which of the following attribute triggers event when the duration and other media data of a media element is loaded?
questionList.answerDetails: onloadedmetadata − Triggers event when the duration and other media data of a media element is loaded.

questionList.question: Which of the following attribute triggers event when dragged element is being dropped?
questionList.answerDetails: ondrop − Triggers event when dragged element is being dropped.

questionList.question: Which of the following attribute triggers event when dragged element is being dropped?
questionList.answerDetails: ondrop − Triggers event when dragged element is being dropped.
